column4: hi there...can someone help me out here.. I have IBM t43p computer and want to connect to the wireless net in my school...The icon says I'm connected, but I still can't surf the internet or do anything...You don't need a password to connect to the net here
fire terminal and see host google.com
or cat /etc/resolv.conf
that way you see if its a name resolution problem
konqueror is a browser
a different take on what firefox, internet explorer and safari do
how's it going?
already solved the network problem or?
you could very well have two ip's but in any ordinary desktop/laptop situation its gonna be more an annoyance than advantage
you have two interfaces configured?
just drop both and reconnect the one you want to use
that'll do it
did you already check host google.com and /etc/resolv.conf
you could also check routes (sudo route), pastie.org the results
map?
it's a file
containing information which your box uses to resolve internet names to ip addresses (and more...)
gotta go, sorry, hope you get things sorted out with somebody else
that looks just fine
does host google.com work?
type "host google.com" to terminal and press ret
i told you to pastie.org the result!
